testcase.brief: The nat-policy capacity on one wan interface is 16 Platform Dependence BR100,BR200,BRAP330,BRAP350
testcase.description:
Pre-Condition: 1. There are 2 wan interface on br:${br1.br.wan.int1} and usbnet0
Test Procedure: 1. Configure 17 port forwarding nat-policy on br, 2. apply 16 port forwarding nat-policy on ${br1.br.wan.int1},check result 1 3. apply another port forwarding nat policy on ${br1.br.wan.int1},check result2 4. delete one of the port forwarding nat-policy on ${br1.br.wan.int1} interface, check result 3 5. add another port forwarding nat-policy on ${br1.br.wan.int1},check result 4 6. add another port forwarding nat-policy on usbnet0,check result 4 7. save configuration and reboot the br, check the nat-policy, result 5

step.desc: Configure 17 port forwarding nat-policy on br
step.telnet: -v "ip nat-policy ${loop.v} type virtual-host inside-host ${inside.test.ip} inside-port ${loop.v} outside-port ${loop.v} protocol tcp"

step.desc: apply 16 port forwarding nat-policy on ${br1.br.wan.int1},configuration are successful
apply another port forwarding nat policy on ${br1.br.wan.int1},configuration is failed
step.log-match: -c -i "Maximum number (16) of nat policies has been configured on interface ${br1.br.wan.int1}"

step.desc: delete one of the port forwarding nat-policy on ${br1.br.wan.int1} interface

step.telnet: -v "interface ${br1.br.wan.int1} mode wan nat-policy 17" -v "interface usbnet0 mode wan nat-policy 16"
